abstracts.cdata!:
Overall ratings convey satisfactory
            outcomes, both in sustainability as in institutional
            development impacts, and on both Bank and Borrower
            performances. Findings and implications for subsequent
            operations suggest that, overall, the satisfactory progress
            made since the approval of the project has warranted the
            move to the subsequent second operation. Although the
            project was prepared in line with the 2005 budget, it was
            not included in the Finance Law, because of the
            uncertainties created by the lack of commitment to reforms
            in the groundnut sector. The Senegalese authorities have
            committed to include the second project in the series, in
            the preparation of the 2006 budget. More attention however,
            should be paid to vulnerable groups in the subsequent
            operations, as was emphasized in the first Poverty Reduction
            Strategy Paper (PRSP) progress report and Joint Staff
            Assessment Note.
